title: Favorite (and surprising) Day 1 MLB draft picks -- and best available for Day 2
content: Here's what stood out to our draft expert from the first three rounds -- and who could come off the board next.

title: MLB draft winners and head-scratchers: What we loved -- and didn't -- on Day 1
content: The first 105 picks are in the books. With shocks at Nos. 1 and 2, here are the winners, losers and takeaways.

title: Sources: 49ers' Jennings wants new deal or trade
content: 49ers wide receiver Jauan Jennings, who is scheduled to make $7.5 million in the final year of his deal, wants a new contract or a trade, sources told ESPN.

title: Sankey: SEC, Big Ten have 'different view' of CFP
content: SEC commissioner Greg Sankey says his league and the Big Ten have a 'different view' on the College Football Playoff format, which could lead to the possibility that it remains a 12-team format in 2026.

title: Sources: Cavs sign Altman, staff to extensions
content: The Cavaliers have rewarded president Koby Altman and other key members of the front office with multiyear extensions, sources said.

title: Rory ditches sleep for Open practice at home
content: Fresh off the Scottish Open, Rory McIlroy ditched sleep for an early practice for The Open Championship.

title: Sheriff: Death of Elway's ex-agent an accident
content: The Riverside County sheriff told TV station 9NEWS that the investigation into Jeff Sperbeck's death after a fall from a golf cart found nothing criminal.

title: Panthers to raise 2nd Stanley Cup banner Oct. 7
content: The Florida Panthers will raise their second Stanley Cup banner on Oct. 7 to kick off the 2025-26 NHL season ahead of their opener against the Chicago Blackhawks.

title: Nats surprise at top of MLB draft with SS Willits
content: The Nationals took high school shortstop Eli Willits with the No. 1 pick in the MLB draft, while Tyler Bremner went No. 2 to the Angels and LSU's Kade Anderson to the Mariners at No. 3.

title: Louisiana Tech returns to Sun Belt, sources say
content: The Sun Belt's CEOs voted to invite Louisiana Tech as the league's 14th member Monday morning, sources told ESPN.

title: 👀 Snoop Dogg helps Swansea troll Wrexham
content: Not to be outdone by Wrexham's Hollywood glamour, Swansea City enlisted Snoop Dogg to unveil their new jersey and take a shot at their Welsh rivals.

title: It's MLB Home Run Derby Day! Predictions and more
content: Ready to watch stars swing for the fences? We have your one-stop shop for the most power-packed day of the baseball year.

title: Open Championship: Ranking the 25 players with the best chance to win
content: Can Scottie Scheffler add to his major total? Is Jon Rahm headed toward big things at Royal Portrush? We break down the top 25 players who can win the 2025 Open Championship.

title: The New Orleans football camp that's keeping the memory of Super Bowl hero Jacoby Jones alive
content: A year after Jones' death, former Ravens teammates Torrey Smith, Bryan Hall and Ray Rice are among those helping Emily London-Jones carry on Jones' mission.

title: NBA summer league: First impressions of the rookie class and other key notes
content: Cooper Flagg led the summer league headlines, but which other rookies stood out in Las Vegas? Our NBA insiders have you covered.

title: Club World Cup takeaways: Rating the tournament, best moment, surprise teams, more
content: So, the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup is over, with Chelsea crowned champions. Time to let our reporters who covered the competition chime in with their final thoughts on the good, bad and ugly.

title: How Clark, Fever dropped 100 points on Paige Bueckers' Wings
content: Behind 13 assists from Caitlin Clark, the Fever put five players in double figures and scored 64 first-half points.

title: The Jannik Sinner-Carlos Alcaraz rivalry is one for the ages
content: On Sunday, Sinner defeated Alcaraz for the Wimbledon title -- the latest in a back-and-forth rivalry that will continue to entertain.

title: Club World Cup triumph shows Chelsea can win the Premier League
content: Chelsea have been crowned world champions -- but only when they end their Premier League title drought will the Blues be able to say they are back where they expect to be.

title: Fantasy football beginner's guide to salary cap drafts
content: Eric Karabell's provides an introduction to the ins and outs of salary cap drafts for fantasy football.

title: Euro 2025 group stage talking points: Best team, best player, predictions, more
content: The 2025 UEFA Women's European Championship is into the knockout stage. But what stood out for our reporters?

title: Chelsea wins CWC as Palmer double stuns PSG
content: Cole Palmer produced a scintillating first-half masterclass as Chelsea demolished Paris Saint-Germain 3-0 to win the Club World Cup final at New Jersey's MetLife Stadium on Sunday.

title: PSG coach plays down Pedro push: Can't happen
content: Luis Enrique said he was trying to separate players during a post-match brawl at the end of Paris Saint-Germain's Club World Cup final defeat against Chelsea after footage appeared to show the him pushing Joao Pedro to the ground.

title: Golden Ball winner Palmer happy to silence critics
content: Cole Palmer spoke of taking satisfaction at proving doubters wrong after Chelsea's 3-0 win over Paris Saint-Germain in the Club World Cup final on Aunday.

title: Liverpool remember Jota in emotional first friendly
content: Liverpool and Preston North End players, staff and supporters paid tribute to Diogo Jota during their preseason friendly on Sunday.

title: Gyökeres warned with fines after going on strike
content: Sporting CP president Frederico Varandas has insisted that Viktor Gyökeres will face fines after he went on strike Saturday, refusing to report to the club's preseason training.

title: England take Wales for six, set up Sweden QF
content: Reigning European champions England thrashed neighbours Wales 6-1 to reach the Euro 2025 quarter-finals on Sunday, cruising into the knockouts on a high note.

title: Sources: FIFA omitted FIFPRO from welfare talks
content: FIFPRO was not invited to a summit meeting in New York between FIFA president Gianni Infantino and players' groups, sources have told ESPN.

title: Messi extends historic streak with 2 more goals
content: Lionel Messi extended his MLS-record streak of multigoal games as he scored twice in Inter Miami's win over Nashville.

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern turn to Trossard after Luis Diaz move stalls
content: Bayern Munich will turn to Arsenal forward Leandro Trossard if a move for Liverpool's Luis Díaz falls through. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: 'Great for settling wars': Trump threatens Russia with tariffs if Ukraine war is not resolved
content: 'It's great for settling wars': Trump threatens Russia with tariffs if Ukraine war is not resolved; issues 50-day ultimatum

title: Kolkata B-school rape: Probe hits wall as 'survivor', her father won't speak; SIT alleges 'zero help'
content: A psychologist's rape allegation against a student at a Kolkata management institute faces hurdles as the complainant and her family refuse to cooperate with the investigation. Despite forensic evidence collection and police efforts to gather information, the family's silence and a lack of engagement with authorities are impeding the probe.

title: Odisha 'harassment' case: President Murmu meets student who set herself ablaze
content: President Murmu visited a student in the AIIMS Bhubaneswar burn unit who attempted self-immolation after alleging her sexual harassment claims against a professor were ignored. The incident occurred during a protest demanding action against the Head of the Education Department.

title: 'We will revoke your US Visa and deport you if you do not ...': US Embassy in India
content: The US Embassy in India has issued a stern warning to visa holders, emphasizing that scrutiny continues even after visa issuance. Authorities continuously monitor compliance with US laws and immigration rules, with potential consequences including visa revocation and deportation for violations.

title: 'Avoid trade roadblocks,’ says Jaishankar - A hint at China’s mineral curbs?
content: During his visit to China for the SCO conclave, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar urged Beijing to avoid restrictive trade measures, referencing curbs on critical mineral exports. He emphasized normalizing people-to-people exchanges for mutually beneficial cooperation.

title: 'Only badminton, all our other choices are ... ': Saina’s old remarks resurface after divorce
content: Badminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have announced their divorce after seven years of marriage, as revealed in an Instagram post by Saina in July 2025. Despite sharing a passion for badminton, differences in personalities and interests led to their separation. The couple, who married in 2018, emphasized their decision was for 'peace, growth, and healing.'

title: Move away from US: China exports emerge strong despite Trump’s tariff chaos
content: Despite US tariff pressures, China's exports have shown surprising resilience, achieving a record trade surplus of $586 billion in the first half of the year. While exports to the US declined, Chinese businesses successfully diversified into other markets, particularly ASEAN countries, which saw a 17% increase.

title: Stanford controversy: Marc Andreessen says wife forced out by uni; VC’s message revealed
content: Prominent venture capitalists, including Marc Andreessen and Shaun Maguire, are facing scrutiny for their controversial statements. Andreessen criticized universities and expressed support for Donald Trump, while Maguire made inflammatory remarks about a New York City mayoral candidate, Zohran Mamdani. These incidents highlight a growing ideological divide within the tech industry and raise questions about the responsibilities of influential figures.

title: As tensions grow at Lord's, Jadeja and Carse locked in heated moment - Watch
content: The India versus England Test match at Lord's saw heated exchanges. Jofra Archer verbally targeted Rishabh Pant. Ben Stokes intervened after Brydon Carse confronted Ravindra Jadeja following a collision. India needed 135 runs at the start of Day 5, England six wickets. England dismissed key Indian batsmen. Woakes dismissed Reddy before lunch. The match remained competitive despite England's modest total.

title: Chinese engineers leave Foxconn India: Govt says monitoring situation; 'Apple has alternatives'
content: The Indian government is closely watching the departure of Chinese engineers from Foxconn, a major iPhone supplier, but believes Apple has solutions to maintain production. Despite concerns about potential disruptions to iPhone 17 production, Apple is increasing iPhone production in India, aiming for 60 million units this year, with eased component sourcing from China and government support through visa facilitation.

title: Magic & Cookie Johnson: Stylish vacation wrap-up; family photo ends trip on sweet note
content: Magic Johnson and his wife, Cookie, recently concluded their European vacation, sharing joyful moments with family and friends on Instagram. The trip included stops in Monaco, Croatia, Portofino, and Cannes, filled with fine dining, attending plays, and yacht retreats. Magic emphasized family time, posting a group photo with his children and grandchildren, highlighting his role as a dedicated family man.

title: ‘Citizens must know value of free speech’: SC flags divisive social media content
content: The Supreme Court emphasized the importance of freedom of speech and expression, urging citizens to practice self-regulation to avoid state intervention regarding offensive social media posts. The court is considering guidelines to regulate online content while hearing a case involving Wazahat Khan, who faces multiple FIRs for controversial tweets.

title: Kirk Cousins benched shock; Wife Julie’s 'really sad time' confession on Netflix
content: In Netflix's Quarterback Season 2, Julie Cousins shares the emotional impact of Kirk Cousins being benched for Michael Penix Jr. Despite the difficult news, Kirk displayed remarkable grace by calling Penix to congratulate him. This act of empathy resonated with fans, highlighting the Cousins' resilience and Kirk's exceptional character amidst a challenging transition within the Atlanta Falcons.

title: 'Don’t know if I can invest': Ben Stiller questions Knicks; Summer League take sparks buzz
content: Hollywood star Ben Stiller, a devoted New York Knicks fan, is unhappy. The Knicks lost to the Boston Celtics in the Summer League. Stiller expressed his disappointment on X. He questioned investing in the team. Stiller has been a Knicks fan since childhood. He used to attend games with his father. His tweet has created confusion among the team and its fans.

title: 'Four balls': England Cricket trolls India batter using Archer’s 2015 post - more inside
content: England Cricket's social media team playfully trolled Washington Sundar after Jofra Archer dismissed him for a duck in the third Test at Lord's. Archer's sharp bowling, combined with a clever tweet referencing his old post, highlighted Sundar's brief stay. Despite Sundar's earlier bowling success, India's batting collapse left them struggling to chase the target.

title: Saina Nehwal pens heartfelt note confirming end of marriage with Parupalli Kashyap
content: Badminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have announced their separation. The couple married in 2018. They met at Pullela Gopichand Academy. Saina shared a message on Instagram. She mentioned choosing peace and growth. Both athletes have achieved significant milestones in their careers. They request privacy during this time. Fans are wishing them well for the future.

title: Indian-origin women die in UAE: Kerala woman in fire; mother, child in suspected suicide
content: A 46-year-old Indian-origin woman died in a fire during a ritual at her Sharjah apartment, while in a separate incident, a 33-year-old Kerala woman and her toddler daughter were found dead in a suspected murder-suicide. The child reportedly died from airway obstruction, and the mother was found hanging. Both cases are under investigation by Sharjah authorities.

title: Indian team reaches Washington for fresh round of talks as Trump's deadline nears
content: India-US trade deal: An Indian delegation is in Washington D.C. to finalize an interim trade deal with the US. The US is reportedly considering a tariff rate below 20%, signaling progress towards a mutually beneficial agreement, with both nations targeting $500 billion in bilateral trade by 2030.

title: Club World Cup: How Donald Trump crashed Chelsea's party
content: And then came the moment that defined the day: as Chelsea’s captain Reece James prepared to lift the trophy, Trump remained in the centre of the stage, refusing to step aside. Infantino quietly moved out of the camera frame. Trump stayed put, flanked by Chelsea players and global dignitaries, ensuring that when Chelsea were crowned world champions, he too was in the picture.

title: Retail inflation hits over 6-year low of 2.10% in June 2025
content: India's retail inflation, measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), plummeted to a 6-year low of 2.10% in June 2025, a significant drop from 2.82% in May. This decline is primarily attributed to positive base effects and reduced inflation across key food categories.

title: Trump admin targets undocumented kids: Early education access revoked - What it means
content: The Trump administration has barred undocumented children from enrolling in Head Start, reclassifying the early education programme as a federal public benefit. Critics say the policy prioritizes immigration status over need, stripping vulnerable children of essential support. Education and health advocates warn of broader fallout as access to other federally funded services is also rolled back.

title: 'Khiladi' in the house! Akshay Kumar cheers India with Shastri at Lord’s; pic goes viral
content: Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar watched the India versus England Test match at Lord's. He was with Twinkle Khanna and Ravi Shastri. India struggled while chasing 193 runs. England's bowlers dismissed Indian batters quickly. Washington Sundar took four wickets for India. India ended the day at 94 for 7. They needed 99 more runs to win.

title: From Chahal to Saina: Indian athletes who got divorced
content: Indian sports have witnessed a series of high-profile separations, with Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap recently announcing their divorce. Other notable splits include Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma, Shikhar Dhawan and Aesha Mukherjee, and Sania Mirza and Shoaib Malik.

title: Gabapentin side effects: Popularly pain drug can increase the risk of dementia by 40%
content: A recent study by Case Western University reveals a concerning link between gabapentin, a common drug for nerve pain and epilepsy, and an increased risk of dementia and mild cognitive impairment. Researchers found that individuals prescribed gabapentin for lower back pain were significantly more likely to develop these cognitive issues within ten years, especially with frequent prescriptions. Read more below!

title: ‘Don't record video while beating’: Complaint against Raj Thackeray for hate speech
content: MNS chief Raj Thackeray faces legal trouble after a complaint was filed, seeking action under the National Security Act, alleging he delivered hate speeches inciting violence. Thackeray stated everyone in Maharashtra should know Marathi, but assaulting non-Marathi speakers is unjustified, unless they create unnecessary drama.

title: Martyrs' Day row in J&K: CM Omar Abdullah scales boundary wall to offer prayers - watch
content: Omar Abdullah, former Jammu and Kashmir chief minister, resorted to scaling a graveyard wall in Srinagar to offer prayers on Martyrs' Day after alleging repeated obstruction by security forces. He criticized the government for attempting to suppress the remembrance of the 1931 martyrs and accused local media of downplaying the house arrests of elected leaders.

title: India's IT hiring surges in smaller cities; 50% jump in H1; here’s why it’s happening
content: India's IT sector is experiencing a hiring boom in tier-II and tier-III cities, surpassing growth in traditional tech hubs. Cities like Coimbatore, Nagpur, and Jaipur are witnessing significant IT recruitment expansion, driven by government initiatives, infrastructure investments, and global tech firms expanding their footprint.

title: Ciara owns NYC moment; Russell Wilson’s fresh Giants debut begins
content: Ciara and Russell Wilson are making waves as they transition to New York City, with Wilson joining the Giants. Ciara expressed excitement about embracing the city's culture and educational opportunities for their children, highlighting her family's deep roots in New York. The move marks a significant new chapter for the couple, with Wilson's NFL comeback and Ciara's ventures.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Main nahi ja raha batting karne' - Why Akash Deep sent ahead of Pant on Day 4
content: India struggled in their chase, losing Shubman Gill and other wickets. Akash Deep was sent as nightwatchman. Ravichandran Ashwin revealed Rishabh Pant's reluctance to bat late in the day. This isn't the first time Pant has avoided batting during closing stages. The team aimed to protect Pant, a crucial player in the chase.

title: Pakistan cricket in turmoil! Audit exposes crores in corruption and overpayments
content: A new audit reveals financial mismanagement in the Pakistan Cricket Board. Millions of rupees were misappropriated during 2023. Irregularities include unauthorized appointments and excess payments. Police meals, coaches, and match officials received undue funds. Ticketing contracts lacked proper bidding. PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi faces scrutiny. This adds to existing criticism after Pakistan's Champions Trophy exit.

title: Lamine Yamal in trouble; under fire for hiring dwarfs at birthday party – Report
content: Barcelona's Lamine Yamal faces backlash after reportedly hiring individuals with dwarfism for entertainment at his 18th birthday party. The Association of People with Achondroplasia and Other Skeletal Dysplasias with Dwarfism (ADEE) has condemned the act, planning legal action, deeming it discriminatory and perpetuating harmful stereotypes.

title: 'No mechanical issues': Air India CEO reacts to AAIB crash probe report
content: Air India's CEO Campbell Wilson addressed employees following the preliminary report on the AI 171 crash, which claimed 270 lives. The report found no mechanical issues with the Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner or its engines, and all mandatory maintenance was completed. Air India is now focused on regaining traveler confidence and ensuring safety, while also supporting the bereaved and injured.

title: Delhi students are using AI to make learning easier, but at what cost?
content: Artificial Intelligence is subtly reshaping Delhi’s higher education, transforming student learning into a streamlined but superficial process. A CPRG survey reveals heavy AI reliance for research and writing, yet trust in its accuracy remains low. While students embrace convenience, educators worry about eroded critical thinking and academic depth, exposing a policy vacuum amid accelerating digital dependence.

title: President Droupadi Murmu appoints 3 new governors: Kavinder Gupta in Ladakh; Prof Ghosh, Gajapathi Raju for Haryana and Goa
content: President Droupadi Murmu has appointed Prof. Ashim Kumar Ghosh as the new Governor of Haryana, succeeding Bandaru Dattatreya. Pusapati Ashok Gajapathi Raju takes over as the Governor of Goa, replacing PS Sreedharan Pillai. Kavinder Gupta has been appointed as the Lieutenant Governor of Ladakh, following the resignation of Brig (Dr) BD Mishra (Retd).

title: Inside Olivia Culpo and Christian McCaffrey’s baby name choice — and the story it tells of love, legacy, and grace
content: Olivia Culpo and Christian McCaffrey are now parents. They welcomed their daughter, Colette Annalise, on July 13. The couple shared the news on Instagram. The name Colette means victorious. Annalise means graced with God’s bounty. Olivia announced her pregnancy in February 2025. Christian expressed his excitement about meeting his daughter. The couple married in July 2023. They are embracing parenthood.

title: Income Tax dept busts major refund fraud in 19 districts of Tamil Nadu
content: The fraudulent refund amount is estimated to be approximately ₹500 crore; tax payers were assisted in falsely enhancing their tax deductions enabling them to claim illegitimate refunds

title: BJP raising Congress’ internal matter to divert attention from real issues, alleges Lad
content: Labour minister Santosh Lad has alleged that BJP had been looting the country’s wealth from the last 11 years and in order to cover up its scams and misrules it was trying to highlight local issues and blowing them up out of proportion.

title: CM launches new ration cards; 80% of Telangana now gets free fine rice
content: Chief Minister says his government is determined to restore the self-respect of the poor through schemes like ration cards, farmers’ insurance and loan waivers; Food and Civil Supplies Minister N. Uttam Kumar Reddy calls the move a ‘revolution in public service delivery’

title: People warned against visiting hospitals in Palakkad, Malappuram as Nipah scare escalates
content: Hospitals limit attendants to one person per patient and mandate masks for all staff, patients, and caregivers. The man who succumbed to the disease at Perinthalmanna had mainly travelled on KSRTC buses, which could result in a long contact list

title: India can deliver 70% round-the-clock clean electricity by 2030 at lower cost, says TransitionZero report
content: The report suggests that India can save ₹9,000 crore annually by transitioning to round-the-clock clean electricity, which matches consumption with power from zero-carbon sources like solar, wind, and battery storage

title: HC annuls appointment of temporary V-Cs in two universities
content: Division Bench upholds single judge’s order invalidating appointments of K. Sivaprasad and Ciza Thomas as temporary V-Cs of APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University and Kerala University of Digital Sciences, Innovation and Technology, respectively

title: MUV safari will resume in Idukki from July 16
content: A multi-department regularisation drive will begin on July 15. Route monitoring committee will inspect the terrain and classify the routes. Only drivers approved by the committee will be allowed to operate and only on the prescribed routes.

title: Bindu, Sivankutty hail High Court verdict on V-C appointments
content: The Chancellor does have powers related to universities, but overstepping boundaries can lead to complications, says Minister

title: Minister faults YSRCP for power crisis in Andhra Pradesh
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar says the Coalition government under the leadership of Chandrababu Naidu is taking corrective steps to rebuild the power infrastructure that was neglected in the YSRCP regime

title: Kerala extends investment subsidy to resuscitate caravan tourism
content: Government has decided to extend subsidy for the project for one more year to give renewed thrust to the project

title: 87,297 cases settled during National Adalat in Dharwad district
content: During the Adalat, 21 matrimonial and maintenance cases were amicably settled, and couples reconciled

title: Previous batch also harassed by para medical staff at RMC: Women’s Commission chief
content: The accused threatened they would share private photos of the victims if they spoke about the sexual harassment, said Rayapati Sailaja after her interactions

title: Chera stone inscription found in Manjeri temple
content: Inscription belongs to Kotha Ravi Perumal, the third Chera king, and is in Vattezhuthu, an ancient script used in Kerala

title: Sena’s Priyanka Chaturvedi demands inquiry into ‘leak’ of AAIB’s report on Air India Ahmedabad plane crash
content: The Rajya Sabha MP questions how international media allegedly had access to the report before it was made public in India

title: Fire engulfs empty rail coach in Tirupati, no casaulties
content: Investigation into the cause of the incident is underway, a committee will be formed to determine the cause and assess the loss, says Railway Inspector

title: Collapsed Kaleshwaram cannot be compared with Congress-era Nagarjunasagar, Srisailam: CM Revanth
content: The Chief Minister reiterated that the Congress flag will fly high for the next 10 years in Telangana

title: Former Civil Aviation Minister Ashok Gajapathi Raju appointed Goa Governor
content: Born into the royal family of Vizianagaram, the TDP veteran leader has served as a legislator between 1977 and 2004, and an MP from 2014 to 2019

title: IIHR and Kilvelur Agri college join hands to develop Mango variety suited to conditions in Nagapattinam
content: With sea-level rising and saline water intrusion threatening agriculture, this research aims at securing mango production in districts such as Nagapattinam, known for its unique microclimate that supports off-season flowering

title: Left parties slam J&K L-G for ‘assault’ on CM Omar Abdullah in Srinagar
content: Strongly condemning the police manhandling of the CM, the CPI(M) accuses Lt. Governor Manoj Sinha of undermining the smooth functioning of the duly elected State government. CPI general secretary D. Raja terms it a “blatant assault on our conscience” and demands immediate restoration of statehood

title: Owners of Chander Kunj apartments to appeal verdict settling review petitions
content: Owners discontented about eligibility for rent and compensation for money invested in decking up interiors

title: Gujarat tops in production and export of processed potatoes in India
content: Production for 2024-25 season stands at 48.58 lakh tonnes, 25% of which was accounted by the processed potato segment

title: ABS cells to be set up in academic and R&D institutions for regulating use of bio-resources
content: They will regulate research activities to ensure that monetary and non-monetary benefits are shared with resource providers

title: Five High Courts get new Chief Justices recommended by Supreme Court Collegium
content: According to separate Law Ministry notifications, Justice Sanjeev Sachdeva has been appointed as the Chief Justice of the Madhya Pradesh High Court

title: Kerala University V-C seeks Governor’s intervention in administrative deadlock
content: Expressing hope that Governor will adopt steps to resolve the crisis, Mohanan Kunnummal alleges that university is being systematically undermined by a group with vested interests

title: Govt. aided schools fail to sustain results in higher classes: survey
content: State government and aided schools scored more than private and Central government schools in Class III, but could not sustain the lead in higher classes

title: Pala diocese opens food processing unit to address agrarian crisis
content: The factory, set up on a six-acre plot in Mundupalam, is designed to process a wide variety of agricultural produce for commercial sale using techniques such as powdering, pulping and drying.

title: Publicise oil and sugar content of Indian snacks, Health Ministry tells government departments
content: Health Secy asks government departments to put up display boards at food counters selling samosas, jalebis, pakoras, vada pav, chai biscuits, and other snacks; to start in AIIMS Nagpur, expand to other cities

title: IIMB to launch on-campus UG programme in August, 2026
content: The entrance test for the courses can be taken by anyone who has finished their class 12/PUC with mathematics being one of the subjects they studied

title: Caretaker, husband arrested for murder of retired engineer in Vijayawada
content: Accused escaped in an auto passing through Machvaram police station en route to Pandit Nehru Bus Station and boarded a bus to Nellore after allegedly killing the victim, says police

title: Shakti scheme resulted in employment generation, says Santosh Lad
content: The Minister says after the introduction of the scheme, the number of women passengers in State transport buses had increased to 45% and in tandem with it, there is an increase in the number of woman employees in the transport corporation

title: Ration supplies hit at Edamalakkudy panchayat
content: Ration distribution halted in Edamalakkudy due to unpaid transportation costs, impacting 800 cardholders in tribal hamlet.

title: All city buses in Tiruchi to be extended up to integrated bus terminus at Panjapur from July 16
content: Buses entering Tiruchi from Chennai, Tirupati, Vellore, Villupuram, Kancheepuram, and Puducherry will take the No. 1 Tollgate, Old Palpannai, National Highway route to reach the IBT and return on the same route

title: Election Commission’s claim of foreign nationals in Bihar voter rolls is meant to ‘obfuscate reality’ and a ‘lame excuse’ for SIR: CPI(ML)
content: Dipankar Bhattacharya says no such complaint was raised during the 2024 elections and Election Commission, in a reply to Parliament in 2019, had claimed that there was no issue of foreign nationals in the country. He alleges that BLOs are being hounded for ‘conveying the true picture to journalists’

title: TDP will win 100% seats in local body polls, says Nellore Rural MLA
content: The Constituency stood first in the State by completing ‘Suparipalana Lo Tholi Adugu’ programme in record 12 days by reaching out to more than 1.27 lakh houses, says Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy

title: DGCA asks airlines to check fuel switch locking system in Boeing 737, 787 jets
content: A senior official didn’t immediately confirm which operators would be impacted. Air India operates Boeing 787 aircraft, and Air India Express and SpiceJet operate Boeing 737 aircraft

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Shakur Stevenson showed that the fight in him is second to none
content: Shakur Stevenson beats William Zepeda to retain his WBC lightweight title . he was promoted to the co-main event of Ring Magazine 3 by Turki Alalshikh . the chairman of Saudi Arabia's general entertainment authority was elevated to the main event .

title: Search For Cricket Ball Leads To House With A Skeleton Inside In Hyderabad
content: The discovery of human bones inside an abandoned house in Hyderabad's Nampally on Monday left locals shocked. The house, located near the Nampally market, had been reportedly locked for over seven years.

title: Court Quashes Kerala Governors Vice Chancellor Picks, Urges Lawful Appointments
content: In a setback to the Kerala Governor, who also serves as the Chancellor of major universities in the state, the High Court on Monday dismissed writ petitions challenging a single judge's verdict.

title: "Nation Eagerly Awaits": Jitendra Singh As Shubhanshu Shukla Heads Back To Earth
content: The entire nation eagerly awaits your return, Science and Technology Minister Jitendra Singh said on Monday as astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla embarked on the journey back to earth after an 18-day stay at the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Haryana, Goa Get New Governos, J&K BJP Leader Named Lt Governor Ladakh
content: Former civil aviation minister Pusapati Ashok Gajapathi Raju was on Monday appointed as the Governor of Goa and former deputy chief minister of Jammu and Kashmir Kavinder Gupta named as the new Lieutenant Governor of Ladakh.

title: "Exemplary Icon Of Indian Cinema": PM Modi Condoles B Saroja Devi's Death
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday condoled the demise of veteran actor B Saroja Devi, at the age of 87, leaving behind a legacy that spans over six decades in Indian cinema.

title: No Japanese Bullet Train On Mumbai-Ahmedabad Route? A Fact Check By Railways
content: The Railways Ministry has dismissed as baseless and misleading some reports claiming that India has decided not to run the Japanese bullet train on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad route.

title: 5-Foot Pit And A Kerala Story: How Assam Woman Hid Husband's Murder For Days
content: A 38-year-old woman was arrested in Assam's Guwahati for allegedly killing her husband and burying him on the premises of their residence. The accused, identified as Rahima Khatun, murdered her husband, Sabiyal Rehman, 38, over a marital clash.

title: 'Udaipur Files' Producers Move Supreme Court To Challenge High Court Stay Order
content: Uncertainty over the release of the film 'Udaipur Files' continues as the producers have moved to the Supreme Court challenging the Delhi High Court.

title: "Happy And Excited": Shubhanshu Shukla's Father As Axiom-4 Undocks From ISS
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's father, Shambhu Dayal Shukla on Monday expressed his excitement and pride as his son prepared to return to Earth after a historic 18-day mission to the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Supreme Court Rejects Plea Against Extension Of Ban On Terror Group SIMI
content: The Supreme Court on Monday dismissed a plea challenging an order confirming the five-year extension of the ban imposed on the Students Islamic Movement of India (SIMI).

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Performs Zero-Gravity Tricks With Water On ISS
content: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, the Axiom-4 mission pilot, has showcased a zero-gravity experiment aboard the International Space Station (ISS) involving water to illustrate how microgravity transforms everyday physics.

title: Explained: What Is The Patriot Missile System And How It Is Helping Ukraine
content: German Defence Minister Boris Pistorius is set to discuss the possibility of Germany paying for American Patriot air defence systems for Ukraine, as he heads to Washington to meet with US Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth.

title: Global Vaccine Reserves Helped Prevent 327,000 Deaths Since 2000: Study
content: Global stockpiles of vaccines under programmes supported by 'Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance,' helped prevent more than 5.8 million cases and 327,000 deaths from outbreaks in low- and middle-income countries since 2000, according to a new study.

title: Indian Woman Dies In Apartment Fire In UAE: Report
content: A 46-year-old Indian woman was killed when a fire broke out in her apartment in the United Arab Emirates' Sharjah, according to a media report.

title: Cashews On Bill, Khichdi On Plate: Probing Madhya Pradesh's 'Dry Fruit Scam'
content: Bhadwahi village in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district has found itself at the centre of a bizarre controversy. It all started when official bills from a local water conservation event claimed that 14 kilograms of dry fruits were consumed in one hour.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Return LIVE Updates | Axiom 4 Mission Return LIVE: SpaceX Dragon With Axiom-4 Crew Undocks From ISS
content: Shubhanshu Shukla Axiom 4 Mission Return Live Updates: India's Shubhanshu Shukla and three other astronauts will return home from space in the next few hours.

title: Tourist From Gujarat Dies In Paragliding Crash Near Himachal's Dharamshala
content: A tourist who sustained serious injuries after his paraglider crashed near Kangra district's Dharamshala city died in hospital on Monday, police said.

title: 7 Murders In 10 Days: Ahead Of Bihar Polls, Spotlight On Rising Crime
content: Gopal Khemka. Ajit Kumar. Ramakant Yadav. Vikram Jha. Jitendra Kumar Mahato. Sushila Devi. Surendra Kewat. Most of these names may not sound familiar. But in Bihar, these names have become central to an escalating political flashpoint ahead of polls.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Great Indian IT Crash: Why You, An Engineer, Still Can't Find A Job
content: In Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Pune, you will find PG hostels full of jobless coders, waiting, scrolling job portals, wondering what happened to their cherished IT dream. This is a story of a generation staring up a ladder that no longer reaches the sky

title: Singapore And London Are The Costliest Cities for Luxury Spending
content: With the current "unpredictable nature" of the world, Singapore is valued for its stability and security. London rose on the back of a 26.6% jump in the price of private education after legislative changes and a 29.7% gain in business class flights.

title: Klay Thompson fuels relationship rumors with Megan Thee Stallion
content: Klay Thompson's trip to the Bahamas led to the usual offseason vacation social media collage . rumors about the rapper's relationship started swirling after the rapper posted a photo on Instagram . in one slide, the rapper posed alongside someone, presumed to be Pete, facing away from the camera .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Christian McCaffrey and Olivia Culpo announce birth of first child with joint post
content: Christian McCaffrey  and Olivia Culpo welcomed their first child. The  San Francisco 49ers  star running back and former Miss Universe announced the news in a joint Instagram post on Sunday. The black-and-white photo collage included images of the couple in the delivery room as well each of them cradling their baby. McCaffrey and Culpo  announced in March  that they were expecting. A post shared by Olivia Frances Culpo (@oliviaculpo) "Colette Annalise McCaffrey" the couple wrote together on Instagram. Culpo posted a photo of McCaffrey with their baby on her Instagram story, captioning it: "Colette is so lucky to have the best daddy in the world. A love like no other." She also added a photo of McCaffrey consoling Culpo while in the delivery room, writing: "The scariest and most rewarding of all experiences. As soon as he came into the room I felt most at peace." McCaffrey and Culpo  married in June 2024 .

title: Why PSG shouldn't dwell too much on Club World Cup rout by Chelsea
content: PSG lost 3-0 to Chelsea in the club world cup final . they went on a tear that saw them win 17 of their next 19 games . coach Luis Enrique turned them into a near-flawless football machine .

title: New rules for EBUGs? 84 games? What to know about the NHL's new CBA
content: the current CBA runs through the end of the 2025-26 season . the new CBA is set to begin on sept. 16, 2026 and runs through Sept. 15, 2030 . it would make the fastest both sides have reached an extension in Gary Bettman's tenure .
